com.pz.reader
Class DataSet

java.lang.Object
  com.pz.reader.DataSet
public class DataSet
extends java.lang.Object

This class parses a datafile and holds methods to scroll back and forth through the datafile along with methods to retreive values from columns.

Version:
2.0.1
Author:
Paul Zepernick

Constructor Detail

DataSet

public DataSet()
empty constructor. THIS SHOULD ONLY BE USED FOR CUSTOM DataSet implementations. It provides NO parsing abilities

DataSet

public DataSet(java.sql.Connection con,
               java.io.File dataSource,
               java.lang.String dataDefinition,
               boolean handleShortLines)
        throws java.lang.Exception
Constructs a new DataSet using the database table file layout method. This is used for a FIXED LENGTH text file.

Parameters:
con - - Connection to database with DATAFILE and DATASTRUCTURE tables
dataSource - - Fixed length file to read from
dataDefinition - - Name of dataDefinition in the DATAFILE table DATAFILE_DESC column
handleShortLines - - Pad lines out to fit the fixed length
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

DataSet

public DataSet(java.sql.Connection con,
               java.io.InputStream dataSourceStream,
               java.lang.String dataDefinition,
               boolean handleShortLines)
        throws java.lang.Exception
Constructs a new DataSet using the database table file layout method. This is used for a FIXED LENGTH text file.

Parameters:
con - - Connection to database with DATAFILE and DATASTRUCTURE tables
dataSourceStream - - text file datasource InputStream to read from
dataDefinition - - Name of dataDefinition in the DATAFILE table DATAFILE_DESC column
handleShortLines - - Pad lines out to fit the fixed length
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

DataSet

public DataSet(java.sql.Connection con,
               java.io.File dataSource,
               java.lang.String dataDefinition,
               java.lang.String delimiter,
               java.lang.String qualifier,
               boolean ignoreFirstRecord,
               boolean handleShortLines)
        throws java.lang.Exception
Constructs a new DataSet using the database table file layout method. This is used for a DELIMITED text file. esacpe sequence reference: \n newline
\t tab
\b backspace
\r return
\f form feed
\\ backslash
\' single quote
\" double quote

Parameters:
con - - Connection to database with DATAFILE and DATASTRUCTURE tables
dataSource - - text file datasource to read from
dataDefinition - - Name of dataDefinition in the DATAFILE table DATAFILE_DESC column
delimiter - - Char the file is delimited By
qualifier - - Char text is qualified by
ignoreFirstRecord - - skips the first line that contains data in the file
handleShortLines - - Adds missing columns as empty's to the DataSet instead of logging them as an error
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

DataSet

public DataSet(java.io.File dataSource,
               java.lang.String delimiter,
               java.lang.String qualifier,
               boolean handleShortLines)
        throws java.lang.Exception
Constructs a new DataSet using the first line of data found in the text file as the column names. This is used for a DELIMITED text file. esacpe sequence reference: \n newline
\t tab
\b backspace
\r return
\f form feed
\\ backslash
\' single quote
\" double quote

Parameters:
dataSource - - text file datasource to read from
delimiter - - Char the file is delimited By
qualifier - - Char text is qualified by
handleShortLines - - when flaged as true, lines with less columns then the amount of column headers will be added as empty's instead of producing an error
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

Parameters:
pzmapXML - - Reference to the xml file holding the pzmap
dataSource - - Delimited file to read from
handleShortLines - - Pad lines out to fit the fixed length

Method Detail

setValue

public void setValue(java.lang.String columnName,
                     java.lang.String value)
              throws java.lang.Exception
Changes the value of a specified column in a row in the set. This change is in memory, and does not actually change the data in the file that was read in.

Parameters:
columnName - - String Name of the column
value - - String value to assign to the column.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - - exception will be thrown if pointer in not on a valid row

goTop

public void goTop()
Goes to the top of the data set. This will put the pointer one record before the first in the set. Next() will have to be called to get the first record after this call.

goBottom

public void goBottom()
Goes to the last record in the dataset

next

public boolean next()
Moves to the next record in the set. Returns true if move was a success, false if not

Returns:
boolean

previous

public boolean previous()
Moves back to the previous record in the set return true if move was a success, false if not

Returns:
boolean

getDate

public java.util.Date getDate(java.lang.String column)
                       throws java.text.ParseException
Returns the date value of a specified column. This assumes the date is in yyyyMMdd. If your date is not in this format, see getDate(String,SimpleDateFormat)

Parameters:
column - - Name of the column
Returns:
Date
Throws:
java.text.ParseException

getDate

public java.util.Date getDate(java.lang.String column,
                              java.text.SimpleDateFormat sdf)
                       throws java.text.ParseException
Returns the date value of a specified column. This should be used if the date is NOT in yyyyMMdd format. The SimpleDateFormat object will specify what kind of format the date is in.

Parameters:
column - - Name of the column
sdf - - SimpleDateFormat of the date
Returns:
Date
Throws:
java.text.ParseException
See Also:
SimpleDateFormat

String[]

getRowNo

public int getRowNo()
Returns the line number the pointer is on. These are the actual line numbers from the flat file, before any sorting.

Returns:
int
Throws:
java.util.NoSuchElementException
java.lang.NumberFormatException

getErrors

public java.util.List getErrors()
Returns A Collection Of DataErrors that happened during processing

Returns:
Vector

addError

public void addError(java.lang.String errorDesc,
                     int lineNo,
                     int errorLevel)
Adds a new error to this DataSet. These can be collected, and retreived after processing

Parameters:
errorDesc - - String description of error
lineNo - - int line number error occured on
errorLevel - - int errorLevel 1,2,3 1=warning 2=error 3= severe error

remove

public void remove()
Removes a row from the dataset. Once the row is removed the pointer will be sitting on the record previous to the deleted row.

getIndex

public int getIndex()
Returns the index the pointer is on for the array

Returns:
int

int - Row Count

getErrorCount

public int getErrorCount()
Returns total number of records which contained a parse error in the file.

Returns:
int - Record Error Count

isAnError

public boolean isAnError(int lineNo)
Returns true or false as to whether or not the line number contains an error. The import will skip the line if it contains an error and it will not be processed

Parameters:
lineNo - - int line number
Returns:
boolean

orderRows

public void orderRows(OrderBy ob)
Orders the data by column(s) specified. This will reposition the cursor to the top of the DataSet when executed

Parameters:
ob - - OrderBy object
See Also:
OrderBy, OrderColumn

setLowerCase

public void setLowerCase()
Sets data in the DataSet to lowercase

setUpperCase

public void setUpperCase()
Sets data in the DataSet to uppercase

setStrictNumericParse

public void setStrictNumericParse(boolean strictNumericParse)
Setting this to True will parse text as is and throw a NumberFormatException. Setting to false, which is the default, will remove any non numeric charcter from the field. The remaining numeric chars's will be returned. If it is an empty string,or there are no numeric chars, 0 will be returned for getInt() and getDouble()

Parameters:
strictNumericParse - The strictNumericParse to set.

freeMemory

public void freeMemory()
erases the dataset and releases memory for the JVM to reclaim

                  throws java.lang.Exception
Writes this current DataSet out to the specified Excel file

Parameters:
excelFileToBeWritten -
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

Returns the version number of this pzFileReader

String
